poem:
Title: "Like Dreamers Do"

In the din of night's discourse-
O, heroic sleep!
Trump's defiant lull,
a resistance staged in slumber.
The bright lights pulse -
Yet he surrenders to the nod of dreams.
Colbert, a raconteur of glowing screens,
weaves news, and new marijuana laws,
into the tapestry of night.
White noise, a drug, and freedom's flight.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Stephen Colbert on Trump’s trial: ‘He lasts only a few furious minutes and then nods off’ Late-night hosts talk Trump’s court naps and efforts by rightwing media to spin his inability to stay awake as a heroic act of defiance. Stephen Colbert Stephen Colbert opened The Late Show with news that the Biden administration plans to reclassify marijuana from a schedule I drug to a schedule III drug, along with ketamine and some anabolic steroids.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
